long_description:
You’ve seen the musical everyone’s talking about. You’ve seen the other musical everyone’s talking about. And this play and that one. What’s next? The answer is simple: Off-Off Broadway shows.

 

New York City loves to categorize everything, from neighborhoods and food to types of theater. What exactly is an Off-Off Broadway show? In a nutshell, Broadway includes all plays, musicals and shows presented in theaters in Broadway’s Theater District with over 500 seats and which belong to the Broadway League. Off-Broadway refers to productions in theaters in Manhattan that seat between 100 and 499 people, while Off-Off Broadway shows are hold in theaters seating 99 people or less and can be located anywhere in NYC.

 

Given that Off-Off Broadway productions cater to smaller audiences, you’re bound to find up-and-coming artists, experimental performances and unique scripts. We’ve done some digging and present to you the gems of Off-Off Broadway venues. All of these venues have events year-round. Each one has its own character and style, so you’re in for some out-of-the-ordinary experiences.

Location: 511 West 54th Street, New York, NY 10019

Location: 161A Chrystie Street, New York, NY 10002

Ellen Stewart Theatre & The Downstairs: 66 East 4th Street, New York, NY 10003

The Clemente

Location: 107 Suffolk Street, New York, NY 10002

 

The Flea Theater

Location: 20 Thomas Street, New York, NY 10007

 

The Gene Frankel Theatre

Location: 24 Bond Street, New York, NY 10012

 

The Kraine Theater

Location: 85 East 4th Street, New York, NY 10003

 

Theater for the New City

Location: 155 First Avenue, New York, NY 10003

 

Performing Garage

Location: 33 Wooster Street, New York, NY 10013

 

WOW Café Theater

Location: 59-61 East 4th Street, 4th Floor, New York, NY 10003

 

When you decide to explore the other side of theater in New York City, make the Royalton New York Hotel you base. Our modern rooms, iconic lobby and central location will be the perfect complement to your theater outings.
